turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Gleninagh.
turn.1: What is unique about the round towers?
turn.2: There are round bartizans in three of the main tower's corners.
turn.3: Is there anything else unique about this article?
turn.4: A number of window openings in the end wall were later closed (likely in the late 16th or early 17th century) so they could be used for fireplaces.
turn.6: The medieval church is of indeterminate age, but was in existence by 1302 (according to tax lists).
turn.7: Was there ever any problems with the buildings?
turn.8: There are some indications that the site may have been an earlier monastic settlement, such as a curved field wall shown on the 1842 OS map which could have been a remainder of a typical monastic enclosure wall.
turn.10: Domestic waste was discovered near the church and there are other signs of habitation such as outbuildings.
turn.11: Did they have any other problems?
turn.12: Absent excavation, however, the age of the ecclesiastical site remains uncertain.
